title: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs, Salerno Style
titleAlternative: Spaghetti con l'Uuovo Fritto alla Salernitana
introduction: Spaghetti with fried eggs is a delightful and simple dish hailing from the Naples area. Perfect for a quick meal or even brunch, this dish combines the comforting texture of pasta with the richness of softly cooked eggs. The key is to cook the eggs until the whites are set while keeping the yolks deliciously soft, and then mix the pasta with freshly grated Pecorino Romano for an irresistible flavor.
instructions: 1. Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Add 2 tablespoons of the salt, then the pasta, gently pushing it down until the pasta is completely covered with water. Stir well. Cook over high heat, stirring frequently.
2. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggs, sprinkling them with salt and pepper. Cook until the whites are just set and the yolks are still soft.
3. Drain the pasta, reserving some of the cooking water. Toss the pasta with the cheese and 2 to 3 tablespoons of the water.
4. Divide the pasta between 2 serving dishes. Top each with two eggs and serve immediately.
